questions.question:
What is the term for the tendency of a 
 body to resist angular acceleration?

Which property of a fluid causes it to oppose 
 relative motion between its layers?

What is the term for the force per unit area 
 applied to a confined fluid?

Which law states that the pressure exerted 
 anywhere in a confined incompressible fluid is 
 transmitted undiminished throughout the fluid?

What is the term for the force per unit length 
 acting on the surface of a liquid?

Which property of a material describes 
its ability to deform under stress?

Which type of load on a structure 
causes it to bend?

What is the term for the internal force 
that resists the motion or tendency of one 
surface to slide relative to another?

Which type of material is known for its ability 
to return to its original shape after 
being deformed?

What is the term for the force exerted by a 
fluid on an object submerged in it?

Which property of a material refers to its 
ability to absorb energy when deformed 
elastically and release it when unloaded?

What is the term for the ratio of the change in 
length of a material to the original length?

Which principle states that the buoyant force 
 on an object in a fluid is equal to the weight 
 of the fluid displaced by the object?

What is the term for the deformation of a solid 
 material at a sufficiently high stress?

Which type of material exhibits little resistance to 
 fracture and tends to break suddenly without 
 significant prior deformation?
